name: Australia and WW2
description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

key_work.title: US Navy Ciné-Kodak Special
key_work.brief_description: Eastman Kodak introduced the Ciné-Kodak Special in 1933. The silent 16mm camera was durable and lightweight enough to be used by combat photographers working in the field and Kodak manufactured a military version in all-black without the usual chrome edges.

constellations_primary.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_primary.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

start.title: US Navy Ciné-Kodak Special
start.brief_description: Eastman Kodak introduced the Ciné-Kodak Special in 1933. The silent 16mm camera was durable and lightweight enough to be used by combat photographers working in the field and Kodak manufactured a military version in all-black without the usual chrome edges.

constellations_primary.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_primary.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

end.title: Christmas Crackers
end.brief_description: This amateur film made by John Sprod re-enacts a reunion between the family members when the four men return to Adelaide from active service overseas during the Second World War.

constellations_other.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

links.description: Christmas Crackers, a 1945 amateur film shot and edited by Australian soldier John Sprod utilised a Cine Kodak. It chronicles his experiences returning home from his service overseas during World War 2.

start.title: Christmas Crackers
start.brief_description: This amateur film made by John Sprod re-enacts a reunion between the family members when the four men return to Adelaide from active service overseas during the Second World War.

constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

end.title: Attack Force Z
end.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Roger Cowland, John McCallum Productions and Bernard Hides
end.brief_description: Tim Burstall directs then-up-and-comers Mel Gibson and Sam Neill in this action-packed Cannes Film Festival selection about the grim realities of World War II, a gritty drama based on actual events.

constellations_other.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

links.description: Attack Force Z is an Australian film depicting the exploits of the elite Z Unit during World War 2. It is most notable for featuring early performances from Mel Gibson and Sam Neill.

start.title: Attack Force Z
start.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Roger Cowland, John McCallum Productions and Bernard Hides
start.brief_description: Tim Burstall directs then-up-and-comers Mel Gibson and Sam Neill in this action-packed Cannes Film Festival selection about the grim realities of World War II, a gritty drama based on actual events.

constellations_other.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

end.title: Australia's Secret Heroes
end.brief_description: Australia’s Secret Heroes uncovers a dramatic forgotten episode of Australia’s World War II involvement. Combining penetrating big-picture history of the Pacific war with gripping personal narrative, it charts the journey of Z Special, a covert jungle warfare unit and forerunner of today’s special force units.

constellations_other.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

links.description: Australia’s Secret Heroes is a three-part documentary series that uncovers the stories of the Z Unit by tasking their descendants to complete a recreation of their training regime.

start.title: Attack Force Z
start.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Roger Cowland, John McCallum Productions and Bernard Hides
start.brief_description: Tim Burstall directs then-up-and-comers Mel Gibson and Sam Neill in this action-packed Cannes Film Festival selection about the grim realities of World War II, a gritty drama based on actual events.

constellations_other.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

end.title: Rats of Tobruk
end.brief_description: The upcoming film from Phillip Noyce is ‘a story of how a diverse bunch of Aussie blokes – including a farmer, a schoolteacher, an Indigenous Australian boxing champ and a former safe breaker - helped turn the course of history – setting their courage, camaraderie and ingenuity against the German “blitzkrieg”.

constellations_other.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

links.description: Phillip Noyce was originally set to direct Attack Force Z, but left the production after disputes with the producers. His upcoming film Rats of Tobruk explores the tales of the legendary WW2 Australian Africa corps division.

start.title: Rats of Tobruk
start.brief_description: The upcoming film from Phillip Noyce is ‘a story of how a diverse bunch of Aussie blokes – including a farmer, a schoolteacher, an Indigenous Australian boxing champ and a former safe breaker - helped turn the course of history – setting their courage, camaraderie and ingenuity against the German “blitzkrieg”.

constellations_other.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

end.title: The Rats of Tobruk
end.brief_description: Three friends enlist in the Australian Army and serve in North Africa, holding the city of Tobruk against Rommel’s forces.

constellations_other.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

links.description: The tale of this division was originally told in the 1944 production starring Chips Rafferty, Grant Taylor and Peter Finch.
